abstract: Directional signs in the subway for the 9/11 Memorial in Lower Manhattan make use of the memorial's own trademark. Is this a benign anomaly, or the opening of a new round of private branding and marketing in the public transit system?
snippet: Directional signs in the subway for the 9/11 Memorial in Lower Manhattan make use of the memorial's own trademark. Is this a benign anomaly, or the opening of a new round of private branding and marketing in the public transit system?

headline.main: 9/11 Memorial Leaves Its Mark on the Subway, All Rights Reserved
